1.name: GPT-4o-mini
1.description: Our fast, affordable small model for focused tasks

2.name: o1
2.description: Reasoning models that excel at complex, multi-step tasks

3.name: o1-mini
3.description: Fast and affordable reasoning model for specialized tasks

4.name: GPT-4o Realtime
4.description: GPT-4o models capable of realtime text and audio inputs and outputs

5.name: GPT-4o Audio
5.description: GPT-4o models capable of audio inputs and outputs via REST API

6.name: GPT-4 Turbo
6.description: The previous set of high-intelligence models

7.name: GPT-4
7.description: An older version of a high-intelligence GPT model

8.name: GPT-3.5 Turbo
8.description: A fast model for simple tasks, superceded by GPT-4o-mini

9.name: DALL·E
9.description: A model that can generate and edit images given a natural language prompt

10.name: TTS
10.description: A set of models that can convert text into natural sounding spoken audio

11.name: Whisper
11.description: A model that can convert audio into text

12.name: Embeddings
12.description: A set of models that can convert text into a numerical form

13.name: Moderation
13.description: A fine-tuned model that can detect whether text may be sensitive or unsafe

14.name: GPT base
14.description: GPT base models can understand and generate natural language or code but are not trained with instruction following

15.name: OpenAI API
15.description: Powered by a diverse set of models with different capabilities and price points.
15.dataUsagePolicy: Data sent to the OpenAI API is not used to train or improve OpenAI models (unless you explicitly opt in).

16.name: gpt-4o
16.updateSchedule: Periodically updated to newer snapshots a few months after a newer snapshot becomes available

29.description: The latest DALL·E model released in Nov 2023.

30.name: DALL·E 2
30.description: The previous DALL·E model released in Nov 2022. The 2nd iteration of DALL·E with more realistic, accurate, and 4x greater resolution images than the original model.

31.name: tts-1
31.description: The latest text to speech model, optimized for speed.
31.variate: optimized for real time text to speech

32.name: tts-1-hd
32.description: The latest text to speech model, optimized for quality.

33.name: Whisper v2-large
33.description: General-purpose speech recognition model. Trained on a large dataset of diverse audio. Can perform multilingual speech recognition as well as speech translation and language identification.

34.name: text-embedding-3-large
34.description: Most capable embedding model for both english and non-english tasks

35.name: text-embedding-3-small
35.description: Increased performance over 2nd generation ada embedding model

36.name: text-embedding-ada-002
36.description: Most capable 2nd generation embedding model, replacing 16 first generation models

37.updateSchedule: Periodically updated to newer snapshots a few months after a newer snapshot becomes available

40.name: babbage-002
40.description: Replacement for the GPT-3 ada and babbage base models.

41.name: davinci-002
41.description: Replacement for the GPT-3 curie and davinci base models.

42.name: Context Window
42.description: Refers to the maximum number of tokens that can be used in a single request, inclusive of both input, output, and reasoning tokens.

43.name: Model ID Aliases
43.description: Model IDs that can be used in REST APIs to generate outputs. Some are aliases which point to specific dated snapshots.

44.name: Model Snapshots
44.description: Specific dated versions of models that aliases may point to.

45.name: API Data Usage
45.description: Data sent to the OpenAI API is not used to train or improve OpenAI models unless explicitly opted in. Data may be retained for up to 30 days for abuse identification, then deleted unless required by law.

46.name: Zero Data Retention
46.description: Available for trusted customers with sensitive applications. Request and response bodies are not persisted to any logging mechanism and exist only in memory to serve the request.

47.name: Non-API Consumer Services
47.description: Services like ChatGPT or DALL·E Labs, to which the API data usage policy does not apply.

48.name: Model Endpoint Compatibility
48.description: Lists which models are compatible with each API endpoint.

49.name: Flagship Models
49.description: Top-tier models offered by OpenAI, including GPT-4o and its variants.

50.name: Reasoning Models
50.description: Models like o1 and o1-mini that are designed for complex reasoning tasks.

51.name: Deprecated Models
51.description: Models that have been deprecated and their suggested replacements.
